14 Exercises: Solutions 14.1 Solutions for 5.6 Return to Chapter 5.6 #1 --------------- sqrt(25-16)+2*8-6 ## [1] 13 #2 --------------- "Five" == 5 ## [1] FALSE #3 --------------- books <- list("Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows", "The Alchemist", "The Davinci Code", "R For Dummies") books ## [[1]] ## [1] "Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows" ## ## [[2]] ## [1] "The Alchemist" ## ## [[3]] ## [1] "The Davinci Code" ## ## [[4]] ## [1] "R For Dummies" # 4 --------------- x_x <- function(number1, number2){ # Creates a function that takes 2 arguments result1 <- number1*number2 # Result1 multiplies the two arguments result2 <- sqrt(number1) # Result2 computes the squareroot of the 1st argument result3 <- number1-number2 # Result3 subtracts the 2nd argument from the 1st return(c(result1, result2, result3)) # Prints all three results into the console } x_x(2,3) ## [1] 6.000000 1.414214 -1.000000 # 5 --------------- # First, install the package. # Second, load the package with 'library()' # or use '::' to load only a particular function once. # Third, call the function you are interested in.
